modules.description: Selects elements from a DOM node using infix syntax. Operates on node types and returns single elements, optional elements, or collections of elements. Used to efficiently query and manipulate HTML structures in a concise, readable manner.

Provides functions to navigate and extract information from a tree-like structure of nodes, including selecting elements by tag, retrieving attributes, accessing parent and sibling nodes, and extracting text from leaf nodes. Works with node types such as element nodes, general nodes, and lists of nodes. Enables concise traversal and manipulation of HTML or XML-like structures, such as extracting the first child element or finding an element by its ID.

Selects elements from a DOM node using CSS-like selectors. Operates on node types representing HTML elements, returning either a single element, an optional element, or a list of elements. Used to extract specific parts of a parsed HTML document for further processing or data extraction.

Provides functions to navigate and extract information from a tree-like structure of nodes, including selecting elements by tag or ID, accessing attributes, and traversing siblings and parents. Works with node types such as element nodes, general nodes, and lists of nodes. Enables precise manipulation of HTML or XML-like structures, such as extracting the text content of a specific child or locating an element by its ID.

Provides functions for traversing and transforming HTML nodes, including filtering, mapping, and folding over elements. Works with DOM-like structures representing HTML documents and CSS selectors to target specific elements. Enables extraction of structured data from web pages by combining selector-based queries with functional transformations.

provides a set of tools for querying and navigating DOM-like structures, using infix syntax for element selection and traversal functions for node exploration. It works with element nodes, general nodes, and node lists, enabling operations like extracting attributes, finding elements by ID, or accessing text content. Users can efficiently filter and manipulate HTML or XML data, such as retrieving the first child element or selecting elements based on tag names. Simple I/O helpers are included for quick scripting tasks, but are not recommended for production use.

Extracts and manipulates HTML content using CSS selectors and DOM traversal functions. Operates on node types like elements, text, and lists, supporting operations such as selecting by tag, ID, or attribute, and navigating siblings, parents, and children. Examples include retrieving link hrefs, extracting title text, or collecting list item contents. Traversals enable lazy processing and transformation of node sequences.
